The damage that earthquakes can cause depends on their location and size. Scientists use seismographs to monitor and measure the size of earthquakes. Whenever an earthquake occurs, the seismographs record the data. The scientists use this data to determine the location and size of the earthquake. This allows scientists to inform people how far the effects of an earthquake can be felt and if they need to find a safe place. Why is this technology useful?

Stem: Groundwater is the purest and cleanest source of water in the Earth. Because of this, it is preferred and most often used for watering crops and plants than other sources of water are. However, groundwater depletion is a serious threat to the environment. Groundwater depletion most commonly occurs when more water is pumped out of the ground than is replaced over a certain period of time. Some types of farming require a large amount of groundwater. Groundwater depletion will force us to pump water from deeper regions of Earth which will consume more resources and affect the environment also. Moreover, it will lead to large bodies of water becoming shallower. Which of the following is the best solution to reduce groundwater depletion?
Choices: A) Use fewer chemicals., B) Utilize less water in farming., C) Reduce salt contamination in water., D) To find alternative sources of water, like rivers and lakes. 6 Each parent passes on one allele to their offspring. Stem: controls that trait. Since 1950, groundwater has been severely depleted in many U.S. regions. In recent years, farmers and engineers have come together to find solutions to conserve fresh water, including groundwater. For example, farmers are making an effort to provide a precise amount of water to their crops. Older irrigation systems used much more water than crops needed, but engineers have developed newer irrigation systems that use water more efficiently. These irrigation systems provide the right amount of water directly to the roots of crops. As a result, farmers can use less water and still grow healthy crops. Which of the following statements DOES NOT explain why it is necessary to find solutions to conserve groundwater?
Choices: A) When groundwater is withdrawn from aquifers, it cannot easily be replaced., B) Groundwater is a limited resource, and it is being used up quickly., C) Groundwater use has become more efficient, but groundwater depletion has increased., D) There are multiple sources of liquid fresh water on Earth, including groundwater. A B C D The gases that make up the atmosphere interact with certain forms of radiation. Radiation is a type of energy. Radiation is all around us in the form of sunlight, microwaves, radio waves, and more. In fact, most matter gives off some form of radiation. We can see some radiation, but most radiation is invisible. For example, a fireplace gives off visible radiation in the form of light we can see. It also gives off invisible radiation, called infrared radiation. A person sitting nearby cannot see the infrared radiation but can feel it as heat. Based on the information above, which of the following is true? Select two correct statements.
Choices: A) Infrared radiation can sometimes be felt as heat., B) Only bright objects give off radiation., C) Most forms of radiation can be seen with the naked eye., D) The sun releases radiation. Stem: In the following punnet square, what alleles do the parents have?
Choices: A) Both parents have TT, B) Both parents have Tt, C) Both parents have tt, D) One parent has TT and one parent has tt Answer the following questions after reading this passage. Selection of Favorable Traits in the Peppered Moth The distribution of traits in a population is affected by natural selection. As a result, organisms with advantageous traits have a greater likelihood of survival. For example in the peppered moth Biston betularia, two patterns of coloration are observed. The 'typica' form of the moth is light colored, while the 'carbonaria' form of the moth is dark colored. The genetic basis for the difference in the color of the moths are the 'typica' and 'carbonaria' alleles. In peppered moths, the allele for dark-bodied moths (carbonaria) is dominant, while the allele for light-bodied moths (typical) is recessive. The external environment directly influences the distribution of the two variants of the trait in the population of moths. This is due to the fact that the color of the moth determines its success in escaping predators by camouflaging itself against tree trunks. Predators are less likely to spot and eat moths that are well camouflaged. As a result, these moths survive and reproduce. This also implies that the presence or absence of predators also influences the trait distribution in peppered moths. The image shows the two variants of the moth on a tree trunk. After industrialization, there was an increase in the levels of air pollution. This resulted in light colored tree trunks getting covered by soot and becoming dark in color. The table shows how this affected the peppered moth populations over a period of time. 1800 1875 Kind of moth 1850 1900 1925 1950 1975 typica 100 97 90 65 21 10 7 carbonaria 0 3 10 35 79 90 93 Which graph represents the data shown in the table?
Scenario Justification: Minimal or no scenario. Question is straightforward recall or identification.
SEP Justification: No science practice engaged. Recall/identification only.
DCI Justification: Some content engagement in answer choices but limited reasoning with DCI.
CCC Justification: No CCC engagement. No patterns, cause/effect, or systems thinking required.
Key Recommendation: Add a real-world phenomenon or puzzling scenario that students need to figure out. Require students to engage in a science practice (analyze data, construct explanation, argue from evidence).

Stem: A B C D The bar chart shows the population growth of wolves in two different parts of Yellowstone Park. The diagram shows the food web for all of Yellowstone Park. Based on the information in the chart and the food web, which is most likely true?
Choices: A) The wolves have more natural predators in the Northern Range than in Yellowstone Park., B) The ecosystem in Yellowstone Park provides more resources for the wolves than the Northern Range., C) The food chain in Yellowstone Park is limited and dependent on the food chain in the Northern Range., D) The Northern Range has more coyotes than Yellowstone Park so many wolves stay away from the range. 41 Mutations cause a in traits which explains the structural and functional diversity of organisms in our ecosystems. a variation stability loss 42 Field mustard is a plant species that includes turnips, napa cabbage, and bok choy. Like many plants, field mustard reproduces by making flowers that then make seeds. Flowering time is the amount of time between when the plant begins to grow and when it starts to make flowers. In good weather, plants may benefit from longer flowering times. Plants with longer flowering times can gather more resources and produce more seeds. In harsh, dry weather such as droughts, plants may benefit from shorter flowering times. Plants with shorter flowering times are less likely to run out of resources or die before they can produce seeds.
